title: Regina, Saskatchewan
summary: Regina (/rəˈdʒaɪnə/) is the capital city of the Canadian province of Saskatchewan. The city is the second-largest in the province, after Saskatoon and is a commercial centre for southern Saskatchewan. As of the 2016 census, Regina had a city population of 215,106, and a Metropolitan Area population of 236,481.[7] Statistics Canada has estimated the CMA's population to be 263,184 as of 2020.[8] It is governed by Regina City Council. The city is surrounded by the Rural Municipality of Sherwood No. 159.
